name: Ginger-Teriyaki Glazed Salmon
author: Dads That Cook
summary: This ginger-teriyaki glazed salmon tastes fancy but is crazy simple to make. The short ingredient list and easy, 3-step process make it a perfect recipe for busy weeknights. Serve with your favorite veggies or sides.
ingredients: ¼ cup gluten-free soy sauce (tamari), or as needed
directions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Line a pie pan with aluminum foil
Place salmon in the prepared pie pan; season with pepper
Mix brown sugar, miso, and ginger together in a bowl
Slowly pour in enough soy sauce to reach the consistency of a glaze
Cover salmon with a thick layer of the glaze
Bake in the center of the preheated oven for 10 minutes
Remove salmon and set the oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source
Broil salmon, checking regularly, until fish flakes easily with a fork and glaze is bubbly and golden, 2 to 3 minutes
